alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 11:52PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT/11 AM CDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Colorado and northwest Kansas, including the following counties, in northeast Colorado, Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne and Sherman. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM MDT Friday /1100 AM CDT Friday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 PM MDT /1251 AM CDT/, trained weather spotters reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goodland, Kanorado, Ruleton and Edson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
